title: Popping Yasuo's shield should count as assist-worthy
body:
If you didn't know, if you damage someone but don't manage to actually do damage past the shield you will not count as part of the assist.
With other champions, shields are a total different mechanic since they last longer and eventually run out, but Yasuo's shield is huge and only lasts 1 second while being permanent before damage is taken*. As such, if a support uses an auto attack to remove Yasuo's shield, helping his carry kill Yasuo easier since the shield is now gone; that should be worth an assist.

*The same thing applies to Malphite.

*Not tested: Malzahar's passive pop interaction with CCs that do no damage (Elise E) and Mordekaiser's shield.

I'm on board with this, but there are a lot of other things I think need assists added to them as well (some of these may already credit an assist, but they're all edge cases so I'm just going to list them all):

Any movement speed buff that any champion who got a kill or assist received within 10 seconds of the kill (anything from Janna's passive to Sivir's ultimate to using an item's active).

Any combat buff (e.g. Jarvan's flag's attack speed, zeke's active, etc...)

Any enemy debuff (e.g. armor reduction, true sight application [e.g. Caitlyn ulting Vayne right before she tumbles, allies kill Vayne before Caitlyn's ultimate fires/reaches vayne]).

Any forced repathing (e.g. Anivia's wall, Jarvan's ultimate, etc...)

And then, while this one definitely won't ever be given assist status, I really do think people should get assists for cutting off the escape path. It's so annoying when the enemy sidesteps your skillshot or turns around because they see you coming down the other side of a small path, thereby dying to an ally and you don't get an assist. You helped, they escaped if you didn't block their way out...

why dont you just take it a step further and have the game give you free gold any time someone dies on the map. oh wait nvm that already happens, errm how about you just get full credit for every kill, 300 gold, for being in the game, yea that sounds healthy for a competitive game.

sarcasm aside, you really think a janna should get an assist for being nearby someone that runs faster to get a kill? shes already providing passive contribution to the kill from doing nothing, and you want gold for it too? sivirs ult does give you assits, and anything like it that is an active abilitiy used on allies. providing assits and gold for passive effects from items and champs is a great way to turn league into even more of a brainless deathmatch. truesight and vision and "escape block" assists.... why not give assits to anyone that walks over a ward they placed and dies too..

What about vision?
Without vision of someone you can't even target them, which is crucial for many champions.

lol yea, id say having vision of someone so you can target them is crucial for every single champion in the game.... but i dont want to play in a meta where all someone like gp has to do is buy a blue ward, and get assits from dropping vision in a lane or at a gank, and also having a global ultimate and get 30 assits without leaving his lane.

Gangplank can use his ultimate to get assists anyway so that has nothing to do with it.

The vision assistance could be made conditional so that only the first one to reveal the enemy gains the assist because vision does not stack. This way, by dropping a blue trinket in your allied lane does not grant you an assist because the enemy was already visible.

An additional check could also be build in if an killing blow has already fired before you grant vision.
So you will not get assists for revealing enemies which are about to get hit by a global/long range skill shot or that last mid-air basic-attack.

I'm just going to ignore the rage and stuff that's obviously going through you and point out a simple fact that's clearly gone above your head:
"When a champion is killed, the killer gets a certain amount of gold, while 50% of that amount is divided up among everyone who got an assist on it."

Note the last bit: divided up among everyone

So they're not throwing extra gold around at all. It's anti-snowball if anything. Odds are the guy that's snowballing is getting the kill or assist already anyways - he's in the heart of the action the whole time, he's the reason the kill is happening. The lowly support who was taken out of the fight so early and is doing their darnedest to make it work though, is the guy these changes would give an assist to.
So instead of a 300g kill giving 150g to the guy that's ahead, it's giving 75g to the guy that's ahead and 75g to the support. Anti-snowbally. Sure, maybe it gives extra gold in cases where there was no assist on the kill, but how often does that really happen? Early game none of these things happen, and late game you're not getting kills 1v1 unless you're in bronze or are the last two tanks/supports surviving for 10+ seconds after a teamfight.

The above was just for your education anyways... it's already apparent that arguing with you is pointless.
